activity-date.narrative: Activity had series of sub activities that last for 5 and half years between October, 2016 and April 2021. All sub activities were implemented in 6 states of the South-South region of the country.

organisation.narrative: All inquiries about the activity should be routed to the National Coordinator of NACGOND.

department.narrative: Office of the National Coordinator of NACGOND.

recipient-country.narrative: This activity was planned to strategically engage with relevant stakeholders which include NYSC members, community persons and media campaigns using the radio, ICE materials and social media channels to mainstream advocacy on National Climate Change Policy. The basis for it was to enlighten the public on the National Climate Change Policy of Nigeria focusing on local adaptation measures to climate change thereby ensuring community resilience which was absent across project communities in the Niger Delta.

sector.narrative: All sub activities have been fully implemented with project closed. Data relating to the activity is available at IATI registry.

provider-org.narrative: Project activities were funded by the Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands in Abuja, Nigeria while implemented by NACGOND partners in 6 states of the Niger Delta region of Nigeria.

receiver-org.narrative: NACGOND is a coalition of CSOs, NGOs, Ethnic Nationality Organizations and academia based in the 6 states of the Niger Delta region, namely: Cross River, Akwa Ibom, River, Abia, Bayelsa and Delta.

title.narrative: State Houses of Assembly, Ministries of Environment, SDGs State Offices and other relevant state agencies were engaged to develop a Niger Delta Regional Climate Change State Action Plan. The absence of this document was perceived to stall required state level climate change mitigation and adaptation measures across the 6 Niger Delta states. The activity garnered technical input from relevant stakeholders for the development of a Niger Delta climate change state action plan with states being expected to buy-in to the recommendations presented in it and on the long run adopt it as their working document.

description.narrative: Project Mid-level evaluation report recommended that this activity be reorganized to give higher results with inclusion of livelihood projects. Pilot beekeeping and rice projects were initiated from the 4th year of the project.

baseline.value: More than 90% of community dwellers still depend on forest (firewood) for cooking in the region.

comment.narrative:
32 communities were sensitised across 5 project states of Cross River, Akwa Ibom, Abia, Rivers, Bayelsa and Delta with 1,398 beneficiaries in targeted states of the Niger Delta who acquired knowledge on the National Climate Change policy of Nigeria mainstreaming adaptation and mitigation measures.
5 NYSC State Coordinators endorsed project objective in 2017 and in 2018, only 3 State Coordinators endorsed the project objective.
495 National Youth Corps members gained knowledge on Niger Delta climate change action programme between 2017 and 2018 project years.
A total of 10 radio discussions were relayed on different stations to the public throughout the project year in Cross River, Akwa Ibom, Abia, Rivers, Bayelsa and Delta States respectively.
Collation of content for the production for advocacy of a comprehensive Niger Delta Climate Change State Action Plan for the Niger Delta Region.
Engagement with six (6) Niger Delta State Houses of Assembly Members and other critical stakeholders for the production and buy-in to develop State Climate Change Action Plans with four (4) states out of six (6) developing state action plans incorporated into Regional Climate Change Action Plan.
Establishment of Ten (10) beehives for beekeeping and two (2) rice projects (upland and lowland) in Bansan Osokom, Boki for six (6) communities had 47 community beneficiaries subscribed to it. 27 subscribed to the beekeeping and 20 for rice farming NACGOND pilot livelihood activities in focal communities of Bansan, Boki LGA, Cross River in 2019 &2020 project years.
